1.content:
Devon- A fifteen year-old boy with anger issues. He is very self-centered, and the only thing that he ever loved was his mother. He has black hair and gray eyes.

Vannesa- A fifteen year-old girl. She is very kind hearted. Her father was murdered by the same people who kidnapped her mother. She has dark brown hair and brown eyes.

Sam- A sixteen year old boy who is kindhearted to everyone but his mother. He is very handsome, and is very popular at school. He was always very rude to his mother and feels very guilty for it. He has dirty blonde hair and light blue eyes.

Cameron- A Seven-teen year old girl. She is very angel like, the good girl in school, the cheerleader. Her boyfriend is Sam. She also has light blonde hair and blue eyes.
1.title: What character?

choices: All 3 go to the police officer to ask questions
They go out to find her mother
Daniel decides to go with the officers daughter who also has low level powers
Police officer shows up with a mysterious letter
Mother shows up in a controlled panic
12.content:
"I know it is hard to take this all in" Vanessa's science teacher paused :perhaps I shouldn't have told you all of this"

"A shadow society, my powers given to me by my mother through an experiment?"

"Yes I wouldn't have told you about if Daniel hadn't had told me you were experimenting with your powers."

"Then why not just kidnap us" Daniel his son entered the room.

"It's easy to get the formula from her then to experiment on you two trying to reverse engineer it"
12.title: Vannesa

13.content:
It was hard to breath in the smoke filled room. My eyes burnt as they were attacked, and tears silently escaped. I squinted to see if I could spot a exit. Failing, I extended my arms and felt my surroundings. I grabbed the side of a table and let it lead me until I spotted the red glow of a exit sign. I quietly questioned what was happening. I couldn't remember how I got where I was, or why. I needed to concentrate on getting out of the building before I suffocated more than anything else right now. I reached the door and pushed it open.

         The bright sun blinded me as I stepped outside. I shielded my eyes with a bloody hand as a light breeze blew on my face. The fire department of Contel county were screaming and running towards me with a stretcher. I turned around to see my family business. flames were coming out of every window, an intense heat was emanating. I slowly fell to my knees as the emergency crew reached me.

         "His vitals look okay, Sheriff McCoy," I faintly heard a high pitched voice say. I gradually opened my eyes to the sight of a nurse standing over me on one side, and Sheriff McCoy on the other. His white hair and mustache matched the faded white of the walls, and his dull brown eyes were staring into mine.

         "Welcome back, son," he said in a strong southern accent. I tried to sit up, but failed as cords painfully pulled me back. They were attached to every part of my body. I sighed, hoping someone would tell me what the hell was going on. I glanced over to the chair next to me, expecting to see the blond hair of my mother.Surprisingly , she wasn't there. The sheriff noticed my confused looked and explained. "Your mothers missin'. I've sent every man I have, we'll find her, son. Get some rest now," he nodded his head, a grave expression rested on his face. My heart dropped, or my BPM went up, according to the machine. The nurse grabbed my hand.

         Calm down, Sam." she said, patting my arm.

         "Calm down, you expect me to calm down?" I yelled before thinking. "What the hell is going on?"

         She sighed, "I'm sorry, Sam, I'll explain later." I felt a sharp pain in my thigh, then everything went black. I awoke later to find...
13.title: Sam

14.content:
Cameron smiles up at Sam as he drops her off at her house.
"Thanks," she says, kisses him goodnight, and goes inside. She settles in to watch some TV a few minutes later. her cell buzzes a few minutes later, with Sam's face on the caller ID. She smiles again and opens the phone. "Did I forget something?"
"My mother is gone."
"What?" Cameron was confused.
"She's been kidnapped. Someone took her and left a note."
"A note?"
"Yeah. 'Come and give up yourself lest you never see your mother again!' Plus some coordinates."
Cameron thought of her dark secret. "What are you going to do?"
"Isn't it ovious? I'm going to go find her."
"I'm coming with you," Cameron says immediately.
"Cam, I can't let you do that, I just wanted someone to know where I'm going."
Cameron took a deep breath and prepared to tell her boyfriend her most closely guarded secret.
"I have a power that can help you."
"A-a power?" came the perplexed voice. "Like what?"
Is your power
14.title: Cameron

choices: Leave a note saying she ran away
Wake up her parents and tell the truth
143.content:
... and empathy," The phone was silent except the quiet buzz of the speaker. Cameron, after awkwardly waiting for a few seconds, regretted her decision. She waited a while longer, and then said, "Hello, Sam, are you there? Samuel," she desperately cried for an answer. No answer.
"You can't be serious," Her surprised boyfriend finally laughed. Exactly what she was afriad of.

          "Of course I'm serious!" She screamed, then cringed, afraid that she had woke her sleeping parents. After waiting for a sign of life upstairs, she continued. "I've never told anyone this, and I thought you of all people would understand,"

         "Cam, please..." his voice faded. Cameron placed the bowl of popcorn on the oak coffee table and stood. The room was poorly lite, the only light coming from the muted T.V, and Cameron felt around for the staircase. She ran to her room, finally gathering the idea to use her phone as a dim flashlight. As she reached the double doors, she heard a voice calling her name. She had completely forgot her boyfriend was still waiting on the phone. She closed the doors as held the phone to her ears.

          "I'm coming with you," Cameron stated, removing her night clothes and replacing them with a blouse, a black leather jacket, dark blue jeans and black high heels. She peered to the full length mirror. She grabbed a comb and combed her golden hair as close to perfect as she could.

          "Cam, I can't,"

          "It's not your choice, Sam." she cut in, somewhat rudely. "I just have to find a way to tell my parents..."
143.title: Mind control

choices: Washinton D.C., United States of America
1431.content:
"I don't know why I would run away," she said to her boyfriend while holding the cell between her shoulder and ear. She walked over to the wooden desk in the corner of the room and dugged around in the center drawer. "What do you think I should say?"

         "Your not going to say anything," Sam commanded.

         I'm going, that's it. So what should I say." She ignored his protest and pulled out a blue ball-point pen and a peace of notebook paper. "Hello,"

         "I don't know, I'll be over in ten minutes..." he sighed as his voice slowly faded and the buzz of nothing on the other line forced her to hang up the phone. "Okay," she thought to herself. "What should I write?" She finally got it! She started to write and explains her decision. In the letter, she writes thats she needed to see the real world and not be supported by her parents money. It really was true. Cameron has always felt bad for the kids in her school who are "less fortunate" than her. She re-read the paper time after time, perfecting every last word.

         "Dear mom and dad,

"I feel terrible for having so much money, when other's have nothing. I am sorry for what I've done, but please do not cry for me, do not look for me. I love you both and Micheal so much. I will be back, that I promise from the bottom of my heart. I love you so much. Goodbye,"

         Cameron sighed as she hung the note on the refrigerator door. She felt a tear roll down her eye, knowing this could be the last time she saw this place, saw her family. "Goodbye," she said while kissing her eight year old brothers head, and slowly made the descent down the stairs to the garage, where Samuel always picks her up. She sat on the bench until the lights of her boyfriends new truck cut through the snow. She sauntered to his truck,momentarily glancing to the giant house she had called home for seventeen years.

          She lifted herself into the vehicle and asked where they were going.
1431.title: Leave a note saying she ran away

info.brief_description: You have a special power of which helps you on your journey to find your kidnapped mother.
info.description:
It's been three days since your mother was kidnapped in front of your eyes. You can still hear her screaming, "I'll be alright! Run," You were to scared to use your power to rescue her. Now, with the help of two of your friends, your high school sience teacher, and a local sheriff, you are on a journey to reunite with mother.

Please put longer chapters and keep the content PG13!!!
